questions.question: What is the mean of the following data set: 5, 10, 15, 20, 25?
questions.explanation: The mean is calculated by adding all the numbers and dividing by the count. (5+10+15+20+25)/5 = 15.

questions.question: What is the median of the following data set: 12, 15, 14, 10, 18?
questions.explanation: The median is the middle number when the data set is ordered. Ordered set: 10, 12, 14, 15, 18. Median: 14.

questions.question: What is the mode of the following data set: 7, 8, 8, 9, 10?
questions.explanation: The mode is the number that appears most frequently. In this set, 8 appears twice.

questions.question: What is the range of the following data set: 22, 18, 25, 20, 19?
questions.explanation: The range is the difference between the highest and lowest values. 25 - 18 = 7.

questions.question: If the mean of 6 numbers is 12, what is their total sum?
questions.explanation: The total sum is the mean multiplied by the number of values. 12 * 6 = 72.

questions.question: Which of the following is a measure of central tendency?
questions.explanation: Mean is a measure of central tendency, while range and standard deviation are measures of dispersion.

questions.question: What is the median of the following data set: 5, 8, 12, 16, 20, 25?
questions.explanation: For an even number of values, the median is the average of the two middle numbers. (12+16)/2 = 14.

questions.question: What is the mode of the following data set: 3, 3, 5, 7, 9, 9, 9?
questions.explanation: The mode is the number that appears most frequently. In this set, 9 appears three times.

questions.question: What is the range of the following data set: 30, 25, 35, 28, 32?
questions.explanation: The range is the difference between the highest and lowest values. 35 - 25 = 10.

questions.question: If the mean of 4 numbers is 18, what is their total sum?
questions.explanation: The total sum is the mean multiplied by the number of values. 18 * 4 = 72.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a measure of central tendency?
questions.explanation: Range is a measure of dispersion, not central tendency.

questions.question: What is the median of the following data set: 11, 13, 15, 17, 19?
questions.explanation: The median is the middle number when the data set is ordered. Median: 15.

questions.question: What is the mode of the following data set: 6, 6, 8, 10, 12, 12, 12?
questions.explanation: The mode is the number that appears most frequently. In this set, 12 appears three times.

questions.question: What is the range of the following data set: 45, 40, 50, 42, 48?
questions.explanation: The range is the difference between the highest and lowest values. 50 - 40 = 10.

questions.question: If the mean of 5 numbers is 20, what is their total sum?
questions.explanation: The total sum is the mean multiplied by the number of values. 20 * 5 = 100.

questions.question: Which of the following is a measure of dispersion?
questions.explanation: Range is a measure of dispersion, while mean and median are measures of central tendency.

questions.question: What is the median of the following data set: 21, 19, 17, 15, 13?
questions.explanation: The median is the middle number when the data set is ordered. Ordered set: 13, 15, 17, 19, 21. Median: 17.

questions.question: What is the mode of the following data set: 4, 4, 6, 8, 10, 10, 10?
questions.explanation: The mode is the number that appears most frequently. In this set, 10 appears three times.

questions.question: What is the range of the following data set: 55, 50, 60, 52, 58?
questions.explanation: The range is the difference between the highest and lowest values. 60 - 50 = 10.

questions.question: If the mean of 7 numbers is 14, what is their total sum?
questions.explanation: The total sum is the mean multiplied by the number of values. 14 * 7 = 98.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a measure of dispersion?
questions.explanation: Median is a measure of central tendency, not dispersion.

questions.question: What is the median of the following data set: 25, 20, 15, 10, 5?
questions.explanation: The median is the middle number when the data set is ordered. Ordered set: 5, 10, 15, 20, 25. Median: 15.

questions.question: What is the mode of the following data set: 9, 9, 11, 13, 15, 15, 15?
questions.explanation: The mode is the number that appears most frequently. In this set, 15 appears three times.

questions.question: What is the range of the following data set: 70, 65, 75, 68, 72?
questions.explanation: The range is the difference between the highest and lowest values. 75 - 65 = 10.

questions.question: If the mean of 8 numbers is 16, what is their total sum?
questions.explanation: The total sum is the mean multiplied by the number of values. 16 * 8 = 128.
